# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution to your problem written in Julia programming language:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end
```

This function takes a dataframe `df` as input and adds a new column `ym` to it, where each element is the year of the date in `dt` combined with the month of the date (both represented by integers). The `map` function applies a function to every element in the DataFrame. In this case, that function extracts the year and month from the DateTimes and combines them into an integer.
